task_summary: Drive down the hallway and stop at the wooden door (the goal).

task_long_description.overview: The robot appears to be a low-height mobile platform navigating an indoor corridor. The frames show steady forward motion toward a wooden door at the end/right side of the hall. The objective is to navigate to the goal location and verify arrival. The BT first checks if the robot is already at the goal, otherwise it commands navigation to the named goal, then verifies success. Timeouts and headings are discretized per library bins; no grasping or manipulation is required.
preconditions: Robot localized and able to interpret the named location 'goal'.
Goal corresponds to the wooden door area visible in frames.
stepwise_plan: If already at goal, succeed immediately.
Otherwise, navigate to named location 'goal' with default yaw.
After motion, verify arrival at the goal.
success_criteria: No timeouts or navigation failures occur.
failure_and_recovery: If NavigateToNamed fails or times out, the Fallback will reattempt until success on subsequent ticks.
If final IsAt check fails, the tree keeps running, allowing re-navigation in future ticks.
task_long_description.termination: Tree returns SUCCESS once the final IsAt('goal') condition is true.

frame_3.now_evidence: Robot is mid-hallway with clear view and alignment toward door.
frame_3.predicts_next: Continued forward motion toward the door/goal.

node_specs.description: If already at goal, succeed; else run navigation.
Checks whether the robot is at the named target.
Navigate to a named location using the nav stack.

failure_modes: Localization drift causes IsAt to fail.
Dynamic obstacle blocks corridor and navigation times out.
Named goal not resolvable in map.
recovery_strategy: Ticking the tree re-invokes navigation after failures.
External planner can update path; upon clearance, NavigateToNamed succeeds.
Operator may relocalize or update 'goal' pose.
assumptions: The 'goal' corresponds to the wooden door area visible in later frames.
No explicit timing or precision constraints are given in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Final IsAt('goal') condition returns SUCCESS and tree halts successfully.
